place.name: ITTERINGHAM
place.gazetteerText: ITTERINGHAM, a village and a parish in Aylsham district, Norfolk. The village stands on the river Bure, 4 miles NW of Aylsham, and 12 NE of Elmham r. station; and has a post office under Norwich. The parish comprises 1, 442 acres. Real property, £2, 179. Pop.364. Houses, 74. The property belongs chiefly to the Earl of Orford and the Marquis of Lothian. The living is a rectory united with the rectory of Mannington, in the diocese of Norwich. Value, £272.* Patron, the Earl of Orford. The church consists of nave and chancel, with a tower; and is good. The ruins of a small chapel are near the church. There is a charity of two acres of land. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
